item.title: Data Networks Episode 17: Making the Network Public
item.description: In this final episode, the lab network is connected to the public internet by bridging Router 3 to the home network. Tasks include identifying local and public IP ranges, updating topology charts, configuring routes and DNS, and verifying connectivity through real-world web and traceroute tests. The episode concludes the full configuration and testing cycle of the lab network.

item.title: Data Networks Episode 16: IPv6 – Making Things Dual-Stack
item.description: This episode introduces IPv6 integration into an existing network topology, covering IPv6 subnet planning, manual address configuration on Lubuntu and VyOS devices, enabling dynamic routing with OSPFv3, and verifying connectivity using ping, traceroute, and web/SSH access.

item.title: Data Networks Episode 15: Configuring Basic DNS Functionality
item.description: This entry explores DNS queries using dig +trace, packet capture via Wireshark, and building a local DNS list using the /etc/hosts file. Detailed breakdowns of DNS packet analysis and validation through SSH, HTTP, ping, and traceroute are included.

item.title: Data Networks Episode 14: WLAN Home Network Analysis
item.description: A comprehensive wireless network survey using Windows 10 tools and third-party applications like WiFi Analyzer. Includes analysis of 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz channel utilization, router configuration, and implications for performance and interference.

item.title: Data Networks Episode 13: Configuring Apache for Distributing Resources
item.description: Setup and testing of the Apache web server for internal network resource distribution. Includes configuring permissions, analyzing HTTP traffic using Wireshark, and updating router/switch configuration files.

item.title: Data Networks Episode 12: Controlling Network Configuration
item.description: Overview of the current network configuration files for routers and switches. Introduction to web interfaces for managing network devices, including GUI access and limitations for Vyos.

item.title: Data Networks Episode 11: Measuring TCP and UDP
item.description: Exploring network performance and protocol behavior using iperf and Wireshark, including TCP 3-way handshake analysis and UDP-based DHCP discovery.

item.title: Data Networks Episode 10: IPv4 Network Address Translation
item.description: Setting up and verifying many-to-one NAT on VyOS, reflecting on address translation concepts, and analyzing private-to-public traffic flow using Wireshark.

item.title: Data Networks Episode 9: Network segmentation and firewalls
item.description: Implementing policy-based segmentation using firewall zones in VyOS, including DHCP setup, OSPF integration, and rule-based traffic filtering.
